reviews.title: Saved by the Knutsford Steps!
reviews.text: Stayed in the Stanford Hillview hotel with my sister on the first leg of a three destination holiday during August. The weather in Hong Kong was very hot and humid but the air conditioning in our room was a god send. The hotel was very clean and our room was quite spacious. We had a five night stay and our bed linen and towels were changed every day. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Even though breakfast was not included in our booking we used the buffet style breakfast a few mornings. The buffet selection was mind blowing with all kinds of conceivable goodies to whet your appetite and certainly keep you going for a good part of the day.

reviews.title: Nice central hotel that is good value
reviews.text: Having made our hotel reservation based on the reviews by other tripadvisor users, the most helpful tip was how to avoid that steep hill. If you go into the Miramar shopping centre on Nathan road (and avail of the air conditioning!!), take the escalator for "Knnutsford Steps" passing by a pleasant cafe called "Foccacino" and turn left at Starbucks,through the double doors and up a short flight of steps and all the restaurants beside the hotel are on your left. Being able to take the lift to our room from the basement was also a help in getting some cool air.

reviews.title: Good Location
reviews.text: I thought the Stanford Hillview hotel was very pleasant and we certainly enjoyed our stay there. I would recommend it to anyone intending to stay in Hong Kong for pleasure purposes.

reviews.title: great hotel for good value.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stamford Hillview during a stop-over on the way Europe for 1 night on the way there and back home to Australia. Great location, right off the central shopping area and near the subway.

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.text: Very well airconditioned which is a must in Hong Kong! Our room was average with no view and the bathroom was very clean. Be wary of the hill though, it is certainly on top of a VERY STEEP hill! The shuttle bus from the airport won't go up the hill, and taxi drivers don't either so be prepared for a steep climb. Otherwise you can access the hotel via the auto garage at the bottom of the hill however there aren't any signs so I assume the hotel doesn't like people using this route.
This is a great mid-range hotel to stay in for a visit to Hong Kong.
reviews.title: superb choice for Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a full week, and we were very happy here. My husband is an insomniac, and I always look for a quiet hotel, which I thought would be difficult to find in such a crowded city. We stayed on the 10th floor, facing the observatory, and he slept great! Our room was always clean, beds were made with crisp duvets, with very large pillows. Breakfast buffet was fabulous, enough variety to please everyone from vegans to carnivores. Staff spoke great English. Internet is expensive in the business center, I think 60 HKD per hour. Easy access to bus routes on Nathan, subway stop also a quick 10 minute walk. SHH offers a free drop-off at the airport line subway station, so don't pay for door to door service if you can haul your own luggage. A group of three or more goes for much less than individual fares. Many restuarants nearly directly outside the front door, our favorite was the Indonesian called 1968. I would recommend the green papaya salad!
reviews.title: quiet, clean, comfy hotel in a great location

likes.liked: — quiet hotel in the middle of Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plan to return to HK again in the spring and will not even look for another hotel, we'll be back.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!

reviews.text: DandT
reviews.title: excellent based hotel

reviews.text: Salem, Oregon
reviews.title: small rooms, dusty, smelt a bit but great value considering other hotels in hk
Only for short stopover
reviews.text: Stayed at the Stanfod Hillview Hotel in October 2007 and had a great stay. Hotel is ideally located to explore Hong Kong. Right in the heat of Tsim Sha Tsui you are never far away from Hong Kong's many attractions. The room was a good size and very clean and comfortable. There are pleanty of good places to eat on Knutsford terrace.
Good location, rooms a little small (even for a single room), and average. Bathroom okay. Helpful staff.
reviews.title: Not bad, not good

reviews.text: A very nice hotel and worth every dollar you spent. Location is in TST area, the central of 'real' Hongkong. Walking about 5-10 minutes to MTR station, near dozens of restaurants and shops, however still it is very quiet. A steep road is not a big problem, not at all. Room is very clean, spotless and the space is decent, it is more spacious than The Kimberley Hotel's room which is about in the same vicinity. I just praise HK's cleanliness standard. Both Kimberley and Stanford Hillview are very clean. Staff are helpful. And off course, the wonderful things added to the value of the hotel is the Knutsford Terrace. We spent every night drinks and have a light meal in different cafes/resto after all-day-long exploring HK. I will definitely go back to Stanford Hillview again on my next trip to HK.
reviews.title: Read and trust the other reviewers! This hotel is a gem!

reviews.text: PS : Because they have other sister property at Stanford Mongkok, it would be easier (before you fly) to print out the name of the hotel in Chinese (it's in the hotel website). It might be not necessary, but just in case. Luckily I did that. When we took a cab from HK Ferry terminal, at first the driver is a bit confused given his limited English, however when I showed him the Chinese name printed, he was driving us right away.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in December 2007 and found the Hotel to be great value for money. The rooms were fine and the buffet breakfast is a must for $60.The evening buffet is also great value for money. Although the hotel is on a hill I would not let this put you off what is a very good hotel that considerably punches above its 3 star status.
reviews.title: It's all true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, it's all true what other reviewer's have written about this hotel.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

likes.liked: — Plenty of room, clean and serviced daily.

reviews.text: We got this through a package deal with travelhouse.co.uk. I will be consice about this hotel as I know it can be a bore reading through reams of text. The following are the opions of my friend and I, and ultimately you will have to make you own mind up wether to saty here:
reviews.title: A really Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The Staff: Overall they are oaky. Not the most friendliest we have met but they were not rude. Language was a barrier but you will find that throughout most of HK.
reviews.title: Great value and location, very clean!
Noisy
reviews.text: The Room: Our room was really nice - for a 3 star we were expecting something rather shabby but we were pleasantly surprised by its size (considering it's in HK where space means money!). The beds were very nice, comfy and seemed brand new. The bathroom was nice and clean and they provided all the little things you'd expect.

The Location: One thing you have to remember about Stanford Hotel is that it is on a steep hill but its not as bad as the other reviewers have made out, in my opinion. It's a nice healthy walk up - my friend and I NEVER took at taxi up to our hotel. Please consider that we are 26 year old males. I guess if you are the elderly you may want to look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Comfy Room, But...

likes.disliked: — Up on a steep steep slope..

reviews.text: Not luxurious but well priced - it's hard to get more room for less. Not well stocked in terms of facilities but that doesn't really matter because you're in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Simple and Cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed at this hotel for 9 days. We both chose this hotel though your site and it was exactly as descibed.
reviews.title: Best Hotel for your Money!!!

likes.liked: — It was so central to everything
likes.disliked: — It was on a hill, but then again it wouldn't be named the Hillview.

reviews.text: We did have a slight hiccup when we arrived. They gave us a room with 2 single beds and later changed our room to a double bed.
reviews.title: good deal
Just perfect!
reviews.text: The rooms were always clean. The staff came in everyday to make the bed with clean sheets. They provided clean towels and always cleaned and tidied the rooms. The rooms were not too small nor too big, but very adequate for our accomodation.

reviews.title: Excellent Value and the hill's not that bad!
reviews.text: We left the airconditioner on every day to keep the room cool, as the climate was quite warm and humid.

Stayed for 4 nights. Best thing about the hotel is the location, with Knutsford Terrace just round the corner. Some excellent restaurants and plenty of bars. Plus only 10-15 minute walk to the Star Ferry.
reviews.title: Great location, would stay there again

reviews.text: Rooms are clean and reasonably well equipped - my tour operator had requested an upgrade as I was celebrating my 40th birthday when I was there, but didn't get it.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again
Great location for Shopping streets
reviews.text: Hotel is well situated for Nathan Rd and Temple St markets, and is just a 15 minute walk to the Star Ferry terminal. Room was fine and bed very comfortable, two singles pulled together to make one huge double.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant reasonably priced although there are plenty of other choices nearby for dinner, not so many for breakfast.
reviews.title: A nice little hotel

reviews.text: Airport Exress train to Kowloon and then HK$30 taxi ride made for very quick and easy transfer. Hotel bus transfer a little cheaper but takes longer.
reviews.title: Not a bad choice...

likes.disliked: — very expensive internet and lack of toiletries

reviews.title: just the ticket
reviews.text: We stayed a week at the hotel from Mar 28 to Apr 4. We read the reviews on tripadvisor.com before deciding to book this hotel. We liked this hotel because it is located in Tsimshatsui. We knew about the steep hill, but there was another way through the escalator and a flight of stairs at Knutsford Terrace behind Miramar shopping centre. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, it is quite spacious in Hong Kong standard. The gym was not well equipped but there was no one using it and it was free to all the guests. We also looked into the driving range on the top of the hotel. It costs HKG$70 (less than US$10) for a bucket of golf balls and some clubs so we did not use that particular amenity but there is a decent view up there.

reviews.title: Quite nice
reviews.text: I got a good price ($82 for a single room). Everything was clean, and the bed had a very nice duvet. The room was tiny, no bureau at all. I am used to Hong Kong hotel rooms, but this was the smallest ever. However, I saw that some of the other rooms were much bigger, so perhaps my small price got me a small room (Room 503). The location is rather inconvenient. I would not stay here again, because I think a no-view room at the Salisbury YMCA makes more sense. But if you end up staying here, don't worry: everything is clean and the staff is fine. One good thing: a 4 p.m. check-out was offered for no extra charge, and the 6 p.m. late check-out cost me something like $15.

We booked this hotel with hotel Travel which had the cheapest price and still has to my knowledge. Prior to departing the hotel arranged the shuttle bus from the airport for us at 80 hkd per person which we thought was great as we knew we could get there hassle free. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel, O.K. so you have to walk a bit to the MTR but you can get to lots of places once you have entered the MTR station and it's airconditioned so you stay out of the humidity on the streets. There is also the added benefit of being in a quiet location, which having heard the traffic on Nathan Rd, was a definite plus. The hotel was excellent value for money. The rooms were a little dated but immaculately clean and as you really only sleep in there it wasn't a problem. We also had a fantastic breakfast there for only 30 HKD. I would advise anyone to stay at the Stanford Hillview, it's a great hotel and won't eat into your budget too much. An excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Great value for money

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, great price, great breakfast!

reviews.text: The hotel is just perfect for the price that we paid. We booked a Standard room thru Expedia for HK$500 per night. When we checked in at the hotel, we got upgraded to Superior room at the same price.
reviews.title: Satisfactory, could not complain

reviews.text: Room size was OK, not cramped at all. I thought the beds were great, very comfortable. Fridge was a good plus, to keep our water bottles cold. TV was good, too. There was a channel that showed movies all day long, so my daughter was not bored while we relax in our room during mid-day. Bathroom a bit small, but not too bad.
reviews.title: fantastic in every way !

reviews.text: We didn't try the hotel's restaurant. We always had breakfast at Starbucks next door at Knutsford.
reviews.title: Great Value, great place.
